snippet: The RoboBee, a flying machine that weighs a few thousandths of an ounce, uses an electrostatic patch and a bit of foam to attach itself to a perch.
abstract: Dr Robert J Wood study in journal Science reports that modifications to robotic bee known as RoboBee have made it capable of landing and resting on variety of surfaces.
lead_paragraph: The RoboBee, a flying machine that weighs a few thousandths of an ounce, uses an electrostatic patch and a bit of foam to attach itself to a perch.

headline.main: A Tiny Robot That Can Fly and, Amazingly, Rest
